snippet: Even as a recent study questions some of the basis for considering organic food superior, the emphasis is shifting toward a more general quest for locally grown and natural.
abstract: Recent Stanford University study, which cast doubt on the value of organic food, has led to confusion for shoppers figuring out what to eat and underscored divisions about the importance of federal organic standards even as interest in healthier, more natural food continues to rise.
lead_paragraph: Even as a recent study questions some of the basis for considering organic food superior, the emphasis is shifting toward a more general quest for locally grown and natural.

headline.seo: Would-Be Healthy Eaters Face Confusion of Choices
headline.main: More Choice, and More Confusion, in Quest for Healthy Eating
headline.print_headline: More Choice, and More Confusion, In Quest for Healthy Eating
